meanings.definition: Sending goods or services to another country for sale.
meanings.sent1: The exporting of fruits to different countries helps the economy.
meanings.sent2: International exporting is crucial for global trade.
meanings.sent3: The exporting of toys brought smiles to children worldwide.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for exporting knowledge made her a sought-after speaker.
meanings.sent5: The company's success relied on efficient exporting practices.

meanings.definition: The act of sending goods or services to another country for sale.
meanings.sent1: The exporting of electronics requires careful planning.
meanings.sent2: Government regulations monitor the exporting of sensitive materials.
meanings.sent3: The exporting of books became a thrilling adventure for the team.
meanings.sent4: The exporting of ideas can lead to innovative collaborations.
meanings.sent5: The history of exporting dates back centuries.

meanings.definition: To send goods or services to another country for sale.
meanings.sent1: Companies benefit from exporting products to new markets.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys exporting handmade crafts to customers abroad.
meanings.sent3: He was caught exporting exotic birds in his suitcase.
meanings.sent4: Exporting creativity can inspire people around the world.
meanings.sent5: The farmer started exporting his organic produce last year.
